document.docAuthor: Snow, Neil, Byng, James W., Munzinger, Jérôme, Callmander, Martin W. & Dawson, John W.
document.docTitle: Syzygium francii N. Snow, Byng & Munzinger 2017, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New Caledonian Piliocalyx transferred to Syzygium (Myrtaceae) with an updated conspectus of the species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Caledonian Piliocalyx transferred to Syzygium (Myrtaceae) with an updated conspectus of the species

paragraph.heading:
Syzygium francii (Guillaumin) N. Snow, Byng & Munzinger
,
comb. nov.
( Fig. 1C ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ξ
Piliocalyx francii Guillaumin
in Bull. Mus. Nat. Hist. Paris ser. 2, 10: 625-626. 1939
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Typus : N EW CALEDONIA
.
Prov. Sud :
bords de la Tontouta ,
Franc 2427
(holo-: P
, not found).

Shrubs or trees,
3- 16 m
. Bark unknown. Branchlets terete, greenish. Petioles 1-8 mm . Leaf blades 4-8 × 2-3.5 cm , obovate to narrowly elliptic, base long-attenuate, margin flat (yellowish green and matching color of midvein), apex rounded to acute. Inflorescences mostly axillary, 1.6-4 × 1.2-2 cm . Hypanthium c. 1.5-2 mm , cupulilform, color unknown. Fruits 1.5-2.5 × 1.5-3.0 cm, subglobular to globular, green maturing to pale red.

Notes. ‒ The type specimen at P of
Piliocalyx francii
sent on loan 90/100 to WELTU (prior to barcoding) was photocopied and is in the working notes of JWD, but the specimen remains missing despite our attempts to relocate it. It was marked “type” with a type label evidently written in Guillaumin’s hand. Given that the information (locality, collector, number, year) on the specimen label matches exactly the same information in the protologue ( GUILLAUMIN, 1939: 625-626 ), and because no other specimens with that number were found at P, we do not hesitate to refer to that specimen as a holotype .
One atypical specimen, tentatively placed here, has some obovate leaves with a retuse apex (Veillon 2888) .

Additional specimens examined. ‒
